description: Originally built as horses stables next to the Grand union Canal for a local brewery, it has been used to store barrage balloons and  various industrial uses over the years, currently used as an artist studio.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: Originally built as horses stables circa 1850 for a local brewery on Catherine Wheel Road, originally called Catherine Wheel Yard.   The location is by the Grand Union Canal, and Thames Lock which connects the Grand Union Canal to the Thames.  The building has had multiple purposes over the years, including storage of barrage balloons which were raised during World War 2.

factsheet.heading: Today
paragraphs: The ground floor of the building currently houses a classic car body workshop and the first floor is an artists studio.  The building is part of a major housing redevelopment of the area which will see the surrounding industrial buildings give way for flats.
